PLACEMENT—4
Dec. 28. PRODUCER-DIRECTOR: Four years TV experience with major network.Solid back¬
ground in film. Extensive managerial & organizational experience. (Supervised first
TV network in Japan as Consultant to Japanese Government. 1952-54) Desires Program
Director, or suitable creative programming position.
Dec. 29. 4 YEARS DIRECTOR TV, DRAMA, CINEMA, with West Coast Professional THEATRICAL
SCHOOL. Competent to handle organization and development of Educational TV or Mo¬
tion! Picture Dept. 15 years Show Business experience; including work as Night Club
Comedian. Capable photographer, still and Cinema. Will work ANYWHERE.
Dec. 30. Major network writer-director-producer, specializing in music, public ser¬
vice and educational programs, desires responsible position as program supervisor
for educational television station. Harvard educated, wide esperience in newspaper
work, radio, TV and films, here and abroad. Recipient of Nieman Fellowship. Married,
aged 40, prepared to relocate for long-range opportunity.
Dec. 31. Mature executive and educator interested in developmental job in planning
and producing educational TV programs which feature current public affairs analysis
and comment, and which capitalizes on the potentialities of the visual medium. Has
developed written proposals and sample formats for such programs. No formal train¬
ing or paid work experience in broadcasting, but broad executive experience in re¬
lated fields: l) Experience in analysing public events and presenting their meaning
in simple and concise form. Special ability for getting ’’inside the news” relying
on open sources and contacts in the Government. Facility in research and writing.
(Fh.D. in Political Science, intelligence work experience in OSS, Dept, of State;
present job Chief of Instruction, Federal Civil Defense Staff College.) 2) Exper¬
ience and experimentation in making combined verbal and visual presentations (”brief-
ings”) for laymen, including conceiving and designing special visual materials. (In¬
telligence work in military. State Department, and OSS; and also teaching and cur¬
riculum development in present job.) 3) Familiarity with current trends in informal
adult education. Acquaintance in adult education profession. Active in AEA.
4) Discussions on news and public affairs program problems with network commentators
and executives.
Dec. 32. School of Radio Technique graduate, thoroughly capable of all phases TV
Production, Programming with wide cultural background in Art, Music, theatre and
literature, desires opportunity to offer his talents as Floor Manager, Program
Assistant and Studio Technician to your station.
Dec. 33. Position wanted in Educational TV for woman, 29; B. A., Masters Degree in
Art, three years teaching experience, Art, Grades 1-12; business experience in Jour¬
nalism, Mural Painting, Sales and Market Research. Interested in permanent work
with opportunities for advancement.
Dec. 34. Man — Experienced teacher - producer , wishes work in
educational television. During semester 1953-54, assistant producer of The Living
Blackboard series, televised by WPIX, New York under the auspices of the New York
City Board of Education. His article, ”An Educational TV Network,” appeared in
the August, 1954, The School Executive. Additional experience: teaching, book
jacket design, editing. Would accept part time teaching in connection with job.
B.S. English, Columbia University. M.A. Hunter College. Working tow'ard Ph.D. at
New York University. Radio training at Hunter College. Television training at the
American Theatre Wing.
